newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybeans end mixed on uncertainties.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybeans end mixed on uncertainties.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended mixed on Wednesday with large liquidation of the January contract due to uncertainties over the short-term market trend, traders said.
The key January 1997 contract ended at 3,135 yuan ($377) per tonne, losing 45 yuan. It opened at an intra-day high of 3,150 and hit a low of 3,121.
March fell 43 to 3,152, May rose 15 to 3,115, July was up 35 to 3,145 and November fell 10 to 3,340. September did not trade.
Combined volume rose to 30,400 tonnes from 16,200.
Traders said investors liquidated large positions in the January contract today with the approach of the delivery day.
"Many investors do not want to hold positions with the approach of the delivery date and the Chinese lunar new year holiday," one trader said.
"The short-term market trend is unclear," he added.
Traders expect soybeans to continue to move in a narrow range in the next few days.
